sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miracle Onyemna)
articles.description: Many websites have some sort of search feature because it helps users navigate through their content easily. Implementing it the right way can be tricky and might not give a good user experience. In this tutorial, we will be integrating Algolia, a popular and powerful search service for the best experience on our Nuxt site.
articles.title: How To Implement Search Functionality In Your Nuxt App Using Algolia InstantSearch

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Get your desktop ready for fall and the upcoming Halloween season with a fresh batch of desktop wallpapers. Created with love by designers and artists from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for October 2021.
articles.title: A Time Of Transition (October 2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Addy Osmani)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll highlight how modern image formats (AVIF or WebP) can improve compression by up to 50% and deliver better quality per-byte while still looking visually appealing. We‚Äôll compare what‚Äôs possible at high-quality, low-quality and file-size targets.
articles.title: Using Modern Image Formats: AVIF And WebP

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: You can find Markdown in many places on the Internet. This article covers different aspects of Markdown and how it interacts with other technology.
articles.title: Improving The Accessibility Of Your Markdown

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: Is end-to-end testing a painful topic for you? In this article, Ramona Schwering explains how to handle end-to-end testing with Cypress and make it make it not so tedious and expensive for yourself, but fun instead.
articles.title: Let‚Äôs Dive Into Cypress For End-to-End Testing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jonne Kats)
articles.description: We made the switch from a more traditional integrated e-commerce platform to a headless platform with Next.js. Here are the most important lessons learned while rebuilding a large e-commerce site with Next.js.
articles.title: Rebuilding A Large E-Commerce Website With Next.js (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: You‚Äôve seen them before. Confusing and frustrating design patterns that seem to be chasing you everywhere you go, from one website to another. It‚Äôs time to fix them for good in a [free Smashing online workshop](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/workshops/vitaly-friedman-frustrating-patterns/) next week.
articles.title: Free Online Workshop: Frustrating Design Patterns And How To Fix Them

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: The new CSS `accent-color` property makes it quick and easy to roll out our brand colors to certain form inputs by leveraging user agent styles. In this article we‚Äôll take a look at what it does and how to use it alongside `color-scheme` for simple, accessible checkboxes and radio buttons ‚Äî and imagine how we might use it in the future.
articles.title: Simplifying Form Styles With `accent-color`

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: We love little useful tools and techniques to help folks get their work done better and faster. Today, we‚Äôd love to shine the spotlights on a little helper that helps spot common performance bottlenecks easily: [ct.css](https://csswizardry.com/ct/).
articles.title: Getting Your `head` Straight: A New CSS Performance Diagnostics Snippet

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matthieu Cneude)
articles.description: Building a development environment with the shell as a keystone offers multiple benefits. You can customize everything depending on your own needs, and the biggest of all, you can control your entire development environment with your keyboard.
articles.title: How To Build Your Own Mouseless Development Environment

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O‚ÄôBrien)
articles.description: The last 18 months have been a time of unprecedented turbulence. As the people of the world have flooded online, businesses have joined them, using web development tools to adapt in real-time.
articles.title: How Web Development Tools Are Helping Users Keep Pace With Rapid Change

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ken Harker)
articles.description: Content scraping is a fact of life on the Internet. When you think of web scraping, you probably do not think about the scrapers turning around and immediately serving your entire, whole page content on another website. But what if your site content is being re-published?  It might be already happening.
articles.title: Are Imposter Domains Re-Publishing Your Website?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Gatsby Functions provide front-end developers a way to write and use server-side code without the hassle of maintaining a server. If making money from open-source is of interest to you and your site isn‚Äôt built using Gatsby, this approach may well be the answer you were looking for.
articles.title: Monetize Open-Source Software With Gatsby Functions And Stripe

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Elie Slo√Øm)
articles.description: Twenty years ago, Elie Slo√Øm chose to dedicate his professional life to web quality assurance. He started asking, ‚ÄùWhat does quality mean for a web user?‚Äù Well, this article explains everything he has learned along the way.
articles.title: Web Quality Assurance: From User Requirements To Web Risk Management

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: Integrating a CRM with your business website has numerous benefits. In this article, Zara Cooper explains what these benefits are and why websites should be integrated with a CRM platform.
articles.title: Reasons To Build A CRM-Powered Website For Your Business

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marcel Moreau)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O‚ÄôBrien)
